# Checklist: Limitation and Deadlines

<!-- This checklist ensures all limitation periods and critical deadlines are identified and diarized -->

## Purpose

To identify, record, and diarize all limitation periods and critical deadlines in contentious probate matters, preventing missed deadlines and ensuring timely action.

## When to Use

- At case intake
- During initial case assessment
- When new deadlines arise
- Monthly review
- Before significant case milestones

---

## Critical Limitation Periods

### Inheritance Act Claims

**MOST CRITICAL - 6 MONTH DEADLINE**

- [ ] **Inheritance Act claim?** [ ] Yes [ ] No

If Yes:
- Date of death: ___________
- Date of grant of representation: ___________
- **6-month deadline: ___________**
- Time remaining: ___________ days/months
- **Status: [ ] CRITICAL (< 1 month) [ ] URGENT (1-2 months) [ ] MONITOR (> 2 months)**

**Actions:**
- [ ] Deadline diarized with multiple reminders (90, 60, 30, 14, 7 days before)
- [ ] Client advised in writing of strict deadline
- [ ] Supervisor notified
- [ ] Protective claim prepared if settlement ongoing
- [ ] Court issue fee calculated and available
- [ ] Extension prospects considered (if any)

**Note:** Extensions are rare and require permission. Do not rely on obtaining extension.

---

### Other Contentious Probate Claims

#### Validity of Will Claims

- [ ] **No strict limitation period BUT:**
  - Delay may give rise to defense of laches/acquiescence
  - Act promptly once aware of grounds for challenge
  - Consider: Has grant been obtained? [ ] Yes [ ] No
  - If yes, when? ___________
  - Delay since grant: ___________ years

**Actions:**
- [ ] Client advised that delay may prejudice claim
- [ ] Prompt action recommended
- [ ] Reasons for any delay documented

#### Executor/Administrator Misconduct

**Limitation depends on claim type:**

- [ ] **Fraudulent breach of trust:** 
  - **NO TIME LIMIT** while fraud concealed
  - Limitation starts when fraud discovered: ___________
  - **6 years** from discovery (Limitation Act 1980 s.21(1)(a))
  - Deadline: ___________

- [ ] **Non-fraudulent breach:**
  - **6 years** from breach (Limitation Act 1980 s.21(3))
  - Date of breach: ___________
  - Deadline: ___________

- [ ] **Claim for account:**
  - **12 years** if no prior demand
  - **6 years** from demand if made
  - Date of demand (if made): ___________
  - Deadline: ___________

**Actions:**
- [ ] Limitation period identified and diarized
- [ ] Client advised of deadline
- [ ] Protective claim considered if near deadline

#### Rectification Claims

- [ ] **Section 20 Administration of Justice Act 1982**
  - **6 months** from date of grant
  - Date of grant: ___________
  - Deadline: ___________
  - **OR:** At any time with leave of court after 6 months

**Actions:**
- [ ] Deadline diarized if within 6 months
- [ ] Consider whether leave application needed
- [ ] Evidence for leave prepared (if needed)

---

## Procedural Deadlines

### Pre-Issue

- [ ] **Response to Letter Before Action expected**
  - Letter sent: ___________
  - Response deadline stated: ___________
  - Response received: [ ] Yes [ ] No
  - If no response, issue date planned: ___________

### Post-Issue

#### Service Deadlines

- [ ] **Claim form service**
  - Claim issued: ___________
  - **Must serve within 4 months** (CPR 7.5)
  - Service deadline: ___________
  - Service method planned: ___________

- [ ] **Particulars of claim service** (if not with claim form)
  - **Must serve within 14 days** of service of claim form (CPR 7.4)
  - Claim form served: ___________
  - Particulars deadline: ___________

#### Defence and Response

- [ ] **Acknowledgment of Service**
  - Claim form served: ___________
  - **Defendant has 14 days** to acknowledge
  - AoS due: ___________
  - AoS filed: [ ] Yes [ ] No - Date: ___________

- [ ] **Defence**
  - AoS filed: ___________
  - **28 days from service** of particulars (or 14 if no AoS)
  - Defence due: ___________
  - Extension agreed: [ ] Yes [ ] No - Until: ___________
  - Defence filed: [ ] Yes [ ] No - Date: ___________

- [ ] **Reply** (if required)
  - Defence served: ___________
  - **21 days** from service of defence (CPR 15.8)
  - Reply due: ___________

#### Allocation and Case Management

- [ ] **Allocation Questionnaire**
  - Notice of proposed allocation: ___________
  - **Deadline stated:** ___________
  - Filed: [ ] Yes [ ] No - Date: ___________

- [ ] **Directions questionnaire**
  - Deadline: ___________
  - Filed: [ ] Yes [ ] No - Date: ___________

- [ ] **Case Management Conference**
  - Date listed: ___________
  - Papers deadline: ___________
  - Skeleton argument deadline: ___________

#### Disclosure

- [ ] **Standard disclosure**
  - Deadline per directions: ___________
  - Disclosure completed: [ ] Yes [ ] No - Date: ___________

- [ ] **Specific disclosure application**
  - Application to be filed by: ___________

#### Evidence

- [ ] **Witness statements**
  - Claimant's evidence by: ___________
  - Defendant's evidence by: ___________
  - Reply evidence by: ___________

- [ ] **Expert evidence**
  - Expert to be instructed by: ___________
  - Expert report by: ___________
  - Questions on expert report by: ___________
  - Answers to questions by: ___________

#### Pre-Trial

- [ ] **Pre-Trial Review** (if ordered)
  - Date: ___________
  - Papers deadline: ___________
  - Skeleton deadline: ___________

- [ ] **Pre-Trial Checklist (Listing Questionnaire)**
  - Deadline: ___________
  - Filed: [ ] Yes [ ] No - Date: ___________

- [ ] **Trial bundle**
  - **7 days before trial** (or per directions)
  - Trial date: ___________
  - Bundle deadline: ___________
  - Index agreed: [ ] Yes [ ] No
  - Bundle paginated: [ ] Yes [ ] No
  - Bundle filed: [ ] Yes [ ] No - Date: ___________

- [ ] **Skeleton arguments**
  - Claimant skeleton by: ___________
  - Defendant skeleton by: ___________

#### Trial/Hearing

- [ ] **Trial/Final Hearing**
  - Date: ___________
  - Time: ___________
  - Location: ___________
  - Estimated length: ___________ days
  - Counsel instructed: [ ] Yes [ ] No

---

## Application Deadlines

### Interim Applications

- [ ] **Application Notice**
  - Application to be issued by: ___________
  - **3 clear days' notice** required (CPR 23.7)
  - Hearing date: ___________
  - Service by: ___________

- [ ] **Evidence in support**
  - To be filed with application: ___________

- [ ] **Skeleton argument**
  - Deadline: ___________

### Specific Applications

- [ ] **Summary Judgment**
  - Application deadline: ___________
  - Evidence deadline: ___________
  - Respondent evidence deadline: ___________

- [ ] **Strike Out**
  - Application deadline: ___________

- [ ] **Interim Injunction**
  - **URGENT** - to be issued: ___________
  - On notice/without notice: ___________

- [ ] **Caveat** (Non-contentious probate)
  - Entered: ___________
  - **Valid for 6 months**
  - Expiry: ___________
  - Renewal needed by: ___________

---

## Costs Deadlines

- [ ] **Costs Budget (Precedent H)**
  - **21 days before first CMC** (CPR 3.13)
  - CMC date: ___________
  - Budget due: ___________
  - Budget exchanged: [ ] Yes [ ] No - Date: ___________

- [ ] **Budget discussion report (Precedent R)**
  - **7 days before CMC**
  - Due: ___________

- [ ] **Costs Assessment (if ordered)**
  - Points of dispute by: ___________
  - Reply by: ___________
  - Hearing date: ___________

---

## ADR and Settlement

- [ ] **Mediation**
  - Date agreed: ___________
  - Position statement by: ___________
  - Offer to be made by: ___________

- [ ] **Settlement negotiations**
  - Offer made: ___________
  - **21 days to respond** (if Part 36)
  - Response due: ___________
  - Offer expiry: ___________

- [ ] **Part 36 Offer**
  - Offer made: ___________
  - **Relevant period:** 21 days (or as stated)
  - Expiry: ___________
  - **Notice:** Can be accepted after expiry (with costs consequences)

---

## Client Reporting Deadlines

- [ ] **Regular client updates**
  - Frequency agreed: ___________
  - Next update due: ___________

- [ ] **Significant developments**
  - Client to be notified immediately of:
    - Court orders
    - Opponent offers
    - Material evidence
    - Changes in prospects

---

## Internal Deadlines

- [ ] **File reviews**
  - Initial review (7 days): ___________
  - Monthly reviews: ___________
  - Pre-hearing review: ___________

- [ ] **Supervisor approvals**
  - Court documents: ___________ (before filing)
  - Significant correspondence: ___________ (before sending)
  - Settlement: ___________ (before agreeing)

- [ ] **Time recording**
  - **Daily** - contemporaneous recording required
  - WIP review: ___________ (monthly)

---

## Deadline Diary System

### Primary Diary

- [ ] **All deadlines entered** in case management system
- [ ] **Matter-specific calendar** created

### Reminder System

**For critical deadlines (limitation, trial):**
- [ ] 90 days before
- [ ] 60 days before
- [ ] 30 days before
- [ ] 14 days before
- [ ] 7 days before
- [ ] 3 days before
- [ ] 1 day before

**For standard deadlines:**
- [ ] 7 days before
- [ ] 2 days before

### Escalation

- [ ] **Supervisor copied** on all critical deadline reminders
- [ ] **Partner notified** if deadline at risk
- [ ] **Client notified** if deadline affects their case

---

## Deadline Monitoring

### Weekly Review

- [ ] **Every Monday:** Review upcoming deadlines for next 2 weeks
- [ ] Identify actions required
- [ ] Allocate resources
- [ ] Flag potential issues

### Monthly Review

- [ ] **First of month:** Review all deadlines for next 3 months
- [ ] Update client on upcoming milestones
- [ ] Identify resource needs
- [ ] Update case plan

---

## Missed Deadline Protocol

### If Deadline Missed

- [ ] **IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED**

1. [ ] **Assess impact**
   - What deadline was missed?
   - What are consequences?
   - Can it be remedied?

2. [ ] **Notify immediately**
   - [ ] Supervisor notified (immediately)
   - [ ] Client notified (same day)
   - [ ] Professional indemnity insurers (if significant)

3. [ ] **Remedial action**
   - [ ] Apply for relief from sanctions (if appropriate)
   - [ ] Provide explanation to court
   - [ ] Seek opponent consent to extension
   - [ ] Issue protective proceedings

4. [ ] **Document**
   - [ ] File note of circumstances
   - [ ] Record of notifications made
   - [ ] Record of remedial actions

5. [ ] **Learn**
   - [ ] Root cause analysis
   - [ ] Update procedures
   - [ ] Additional training if needed

---

## Special Circumstances

### Court Holidays

- [ ] **Check court closure dates**
- [ ] Adjust deadlines if falling on:
  - [ ] Weekend
  - [ ] Bank holiday
  - [ ] Christmas/New Year closure
  - [ ] Other court closure

**Rule:** If deadline falls on day court is closed, automatically extended to next business day (CPR 2.8)

### Time Calculations

**Clear Days:** Exclude day of service and day of hearing (CPR 2.8)

**Working Days:** Monday-Friday excluding bank holidays and court closures

**Service:** Deemed date depends on method (CPR 6.14)
- First class post: 2nd day after posting
- Document exchange: 2nd day after leaving at DX
- Email: Next business day if sent before 4:30pm

---

## Deadline Extension Requests

### Seeking Extension from Opponent

- [ ] **Make request promptly**
  - Reason for extension: ___________
  - Extension sought to: ___________
  - Requested by: ___________

- [ ] **Confirm in writing**
  - Email confirmation sent: ___________
  - Opponent consent: [ ] Yes [ ] No - Date: ___________

- [ ] **Notify court** (if consent order required)

### Court Application for Extension

- [ ] **Application notice** filed
- [ ] **Evidence** in support filed
- [ ] **Fee** paid
- [ ] **Good reason** demonstrated
- [ ] **Opponent** notified/served
